entities.name: Harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as being angry and not speaking to Hermione in Charms class.

entities.name: Hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as being present in the classroom.

entities.name: Ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as whispering to Hermione and expressing his desire for Umbridge to get what she deserves.

entities.name: Umbridge
entities.description: Umbridge is mentioned as sitting in a corner with a clipboard.

entities.name: Professor McGonagall
entities.description: Professor McGonagall is mentioned as marching into the room without acknowledging Professor Umbridge's presence.

entities.name: Mr. Finnigan
entities.description: Mr. Finnigan is mentioned as being called upon by Professor McGonagall to hand back homework.

entities.name: Miss Brown
entities.description: Miss Brown is mentioned as being called upon by Professor McGonagall to take a box of mice and distribute them to students.

relationships.description: Harry is angry with Umbridge, as described in the text: 'the sight of her drove the memory of breakfast right out of his head'.
Ron supports Harry's anger towards Umbridge, as described in the text: 'Letâ€™s see Umbridge get what she deserves.'
Professor McGonagall disapproves of Professor Umbridge's presence, as described in the text: 'That will do'.
Mr. Finnigan obeys Professor McGonagall's instructions to hand back homework, as described in the text: 'Mr. Finnigan, kindly come here and hand back the homework'.
Miss Brown obeys Professor McGonagall's instructions to take a box of mice and distribute them to students, as described in the text: 'Miss Brown, please take this box of mice'.
